alert.note: Alert for Cloud; Ottawa; Republic (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 3:05PM CDT until April 08 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 008, 020, AND 034... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 008, 020, AND 034... The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM CDT Friday. * WIND...Northwest wind 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph today. Northwest winds continue Friday between 15 and 25 mph with gusts of 30 to 35mph. * HUMIDITY...25 to 35 percent through this afternoon. 17 to 22 percent Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid outdoor burning.
